verses.roman:
sasnus tatra tataḥ sarve
varṇāśrama-yutā narāḥ
mahā-pātaky api yataḥ
sadyo mucyeta kilbiṣāt

synonyms: sasnuḥ—bathed; tatra—there; tataḥ—after this; sarve—all; varṇa-āśrama—the social system of sanctified occupational and spiritual orders; yutāḥ—who belonged to; narāḥ—humans; mahā—greatly; pātakī—one who is sinful; api—even; yataḥ—by which; sadyaḥ—immediately; mucyeta—can be freed; kilbiṣāt—from contamination.
translation: All the citizens belonging to the various orders of varṇa and āśrama then bathed in that place, where even the most grievous sinner can immediately be freed from all sinful reactions.
